title: How to Make Chocolate Swirls

steps.headline: Gather the cookie ingredients and place them within reach on the kitchen counter.
Pre-soften butter by letting it sit on the counter.
steps.description: Softened butter makes is easier to whip up with the other ingredients. The extra air that is whipped up in the creaming stage makes for cookies that are light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 Celsius).
Get a large bowl out for combining the butter and sugars.
Put the butter in the bowl and pour in the white sugar and brown sugar.
Add cream cheese, egg, and vanilla extract to the butter and sugar mixture, and combine by mixing with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until the texture is creamy and smooth.
steps.description: Set aside on the counter when mixing is complete.

steps.headline: Take out a separate bowl and combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
steps.description:
Mix gently with wooden spoon, taking care not to let flour fly out of the bowl. Pour the flour mixture into the creamed mixture and combine until a soft dough is formed. Set these cookie ingredients aside on counter. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Take out a small saucepan and pour in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips.
Turn on low heat and slowly melt the semisweet chocolate pieces, stirring as needed.
steps.description:
Keep heat low to avoid scorching the chocolate. Alternatively, you can use a double boiler to melt chocolate. Place the chocolate pieces in a small pan and place the pan over a pan of boiling water. This method will melt the chocolate without burning it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/61\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/61\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into the dough mixture, folding it in just enough to give it a marbled texture.
steps.description:
Avoid over-mixing; this is an important aspect in knowing how to make chocolate swirls. Over-mixing the chocolate and cream cheese will eliminate the "swirl" effect. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Take out a cookie sheet.
steps.description: Do not grease the sheet, as there is enough oil in the cookies to keep the them from sticking to the sheet. Adding additional oil can lead to over browning and burning of the bottom of the cookies.

steps.headline: Drop the dough in cookie-sized spoonfuls onto the ungreased cookie sheet.
steps.description:
Set the cookies apart by about 2 inches (5.1 centimeters). Place the cookie sheet into the heated oven. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are a golden brown color. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/62\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/62\/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg\/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Let the cookies cool before removing from the cookie sheet by spatula.
Place cookies on a plate and serve.

text:
Gather the cookie ingredients and place them within reach on the kitchen counter. Pre-soften butter by letting it sit on the counter. Softened butter makes is easier to whip up with the other ingredients. The extra air that is whipped up in the creaming stage makes for cookies that are light and fluffy. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 Celsius). Get a large bowl out for combining the butter and sugars. Put the butter in the bowl and pour in the white sugar and brown sugar. Add cream cheese, egg, and vanilla extract to the butter and sugar mixture, and combine by mixing with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until the texture is creamy and smooth. Set aside on the counter when mixing is complete. Take out a separate bowl and combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Mix gently with wooden spoon, taking care not to let flour fly out of the bowl. Pour the flour mixture into the creamed mixture and combine until a soft dough is formed. Set these cookie ingredients aside on counter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/5c/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Take out a small saucepan and pour in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips. Turn on low heat and slowly melt the semisweet chocolate pieces, stirring as needed. Keep heat low to avoid scorching the chocolate. Alternatively, you can use a double boiler to melt chocolate. Place the chocolate pieces in a small pan and place the pan over a pan of boiling water. This method will melt the chocolate without burning it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/61/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pour the melted chocolate into the dough mixture, folding it in just enough to give it a marbled texture. Avoid over-mixing; this is an important aspect in knowing how to make chocolate swirls. Over-mixing the chocolate and cream cheese will eliminate the "swirl" effect. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/73/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Take out a cookie sheet. Do not grease the sheet, as there is enough oil in the cookies to keep the them from sticking to the sheet. Adding additional oil can lead to over browning and burning of the bottom of the cookies. Drop the dough in cookie-sized spoonfuls onto the ungreased cookie sheet. Set the cookies apart by about 2 inches (5.1 centimeters). Place the cookie sheet into the heated oven. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are a golden brown color. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/62/Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg/aid1406350-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Swirls-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Let the cookies cool before removing from the cookie sheet by spatula. Place cookies on a plate and serve.
